messages.subject: Defend myself to othere?  Nope!
messages.msgSnippet: Olivia, LOL, I enjoy getting agitated!  But you didn t really, I just wanted to say what I had to say in the right way, and I was to sleepy! I understand what
messages.messageBody:
Olivia,
LOL, I enjoy getting agitated! But you didn't really, I just wanted to say
what I had to say in the right way, and I was to sleepy!
I understand what you mean now, when I first read the post I thought it was
just that everyone wanted to talk to her about hsing and she didn't always
want to talk about it. Like she was the center of attention and didn't like
it.

No one likes to defend themselves all the time, I just simply don't. One
time and one time only someone tried to start some stuff with my girlfriend
and I at the music school. Her son is very disruptive and has been all but
kicked out of school. Anyway, she started talking to us and my girlfriend
always feels she has to be defensive. Then the woman started on me and said
something about socialization. I looked at my friend and we both just burst
out laughing. Then I told her we had no problem and turned around and walk
off. My friend spent another ten minutes before she could tear herself away.
I don't mess with em. If they start, just say, If you are really interested
and want to know, I will be glad to share, if you want to debate, find
someone else, I am here for pleasure. If they persist, walk away and THEN
you know you need new acquaintances. That's the way I look at it anyway!

Teresa, ; >
